attachments.title: Medical chatbot using OpenAI’s GPT-3 told a fake patient to kill themselves
attachments.text: We’re used to medical chatbots giving dangerous advice, but one based on OpenAI’s GPT-3 took it much further.

text: Yeah, it's not artificial intelligence, it's artificial cleverness. At least GPT-3 et al. prove something interesting: it's actually easy to get a system to produce grammatical sentences without having grammar preprogrammed inside it (thus invalidating Chomsky's UG claims completely). What's hard is keeping track of a _changing_ context and relevant _transient_ information (something which I don't see happening as long as our models can only update their parameters during training and not during inference).
